titleStmt.title: W. J. Brewer, H. M. Buckley, and L. P. Owens to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4305

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
New Castle Oct 7th 1863
To his Excellency T E Bramlette Governor of Kentucky.

At the September term of of the Henry Circuit Court A fine of Forty Dollars was assessed against Virginia Payne for permitting her slave Tom to hire his time. The proof in the case was that she had hired the Man to her nephew T. J. Owens from the 1st March 1862 to the March 1863 and had not been Allowed to hire his own time. Your petitioners pray that the fine may be remitted

W. J. Brewer Shff H Co
H. M. Buckley
L. P. Owens

Remit the fine except costs & fees
Tho E Bramlette
